info.description:
# Introduction

Admin API v2 for Dialpad.

Requests and responses from the admin API are provided in the JSON format.

# Pagination

List APIs support a limit and cursor parameter.

The limit defines the number of results to return. For the first request, pass in a desired limit.
The API response will contain a cursor field with a special string. Pass this special string into
the next request to retrieve the next page.

# Authentication

All requests are authenticated via an API key in the query parameter or as a bearer token in the
Authorization header.

An API key can be acquired from the Dialpad admin web portal.

Note: If you received your API key from the Dialpad support team rather than the web portal, the
user associated with your key must have company administrator permissions.
info.title: api

get.description: Gets mainline operators for an office.
Gets company information.
Gets an office by id.
Get the transcript of a call.
get.summary: Get the transcript of a call

get.description: Gets the plan for an office.

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A token used to return the next page of a previous request. Use the cursor provided in the previous response.
parameters.name: cursor

Gets operators for a call center.

Assigns a number to a room. The number will automatically be taken from the company's reserved block if there are reserved numbers, otherwise a number will be auto-assigned from the provided area code.
Increments the license counts for the office plan.

get.description: Gets all the call centers for an office.

post.description: Begins processing statistics asynchronously, returning a request id to get the status and result of the result. The results should be queried by calling GET /stats/{request_id}. Stats for the whole company will be processed by default. An office_id can be provided to limit stats to a single office. A target_id and target_type can be provided to limit stats to a single target.

Assigns a number to a user. The number will automatically be taken from the company's reserved block if there are reserved numbers, otherwise a number will be auto-assigned from the provided area code.

parameters.description: The call event subscription's hook id.
parameters.name: id

put.description: Create a call event subscription for your company. Call events will be sent to the provided URL. Each subscription should be created with an id in the URL, which can be used to get and delete the subscription in the future. If a secret is provided, call events will be encoded and signed in the JWT format using the shared secret with the HS256 algorithm. The JWT payload should be decoded and the signature verified to ensure that the event came from Dialpad. If no secret is provided, unencoded events will be sent in the JSON format. It is recommended to provide a secret so that you can verify the authenticity of the event. Call states can be used to limit the states for which call events are sent. Use ['all'] to get events for all states. A target_type and target_id may optionally be provided to scope the events only to calls to/from that target.

parameters.description: The call event subscription's hook id.
parameters.name: id

delete.description: Deletes a call event subscription by id.

parameters.description: The call event subscription's hook id.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Gets operators for a department.

bearer_token.description:
The API key can be put in the Authorization header.

i.e. Authorization: Bearer
bearer_token.name: Authorization

api_key_in_url.description:
The API key can be put in the URL parameters.

i.e. ?apikey=
api_key_in_url.name: apikey

outbound_caller_id.description: The e164-formatted number shown to the call recipient (or "blocked").                              If set to "blocked", the recipient will receive a call from                              "unknown caller"

group_id.description: The ID of a group that will be used to initiate the call.

group_type.description: The type of a group that will be used to initiate the call.

custom_data.description: Extra data to associate with the call.

type.description: Type (vendor) of the desk phone. Use sip for generic types.

mac_address.description: MAC address of the desk phone.

phone_numbers.description: A list of all phone numbers assigned to the room. Numbers can be re-ordered or removed from this list to unassign them.

items.description: Public representation of a desk phone.

is_recording.description: Whether or not recording should be enabled.

recording_type.description: For group calls (call centers, departments, etc.), whether or not to toggle recording for the operator call (personal recording), the group call (department recording), or both.

play_message.description: Whether or not to play a message to indicate the call is being recorded (or recording has stopped).

open.description: Group routing options for open or closed states.

closed.description: Group routing options for open or closed states.

phone_number.description: The e164-formatted number to call back.

call_center_id.description: The ID of a call center that will be used to fulfill the callback.

area_code.description: An area code to attempt to use if a reserved pool number is not provided. If no area code is provided, the office's area code will be used.

number.description: A phone number from the reserved pool to attempt to assign.

fax_line_delta.description: Number of fax line licenses to increment.

days_ago_start.description: Start of the date range to get statistics for. This is the number of days to look back relative to the current day. Used in conjunction with days_ago_end to specify a range.

export_type.description: Whether to return aggregated statistics (stats), or individual rows for each record (records).

days_ago_end.description: End of the date range to get statistics for. This is the number of days to look back relative to the current day. Used in conjunction with days_ago_start to specify a range.

coaching_group.description: Whether or not the the statistics should be for trainees of the coach with the given target_id.

office_id.description: ID of the office to get statistics for. If a target_id and target_type are passed in this value is ignored and instead the target is used.

is_today.description: Whether or not the statistics are for the current day. days_ago_start and days_ago_end are ignored if this is passed in.

timezone.description: Timezone using a tz database name.

stat_type.description: The type of statistics to be returned.

admin_office_ids.description: The list of admin office IDs. This is used to set the user as an office admin for the offices with the provided IDs.

license.description: The user's license type. Changing this affects billing for the user.

extension.description: The user's new extension number. Extensions are optional in Dialpad and turned off by default. If you want extensions please contact support to enable them.

is_super_admin.description: Whether or not the user is a super admin (company level administrator).

office_id.description: The user's office id. If provided, the user will be moved to this office. For international offices, the user must not have phone numbers assigned. Once the transfer is complete, your admin can add the phone numbers via the user assign number API. Only supported on paid accounts and there must be enough licenses to transfer the user to the destination office.

state.description: The user's state. This is used to suspend or re-activate a user.

phone_numbers.description: The user's phone numbers. This can be used to re-order or remove numbers. To assign a new number, use the assign number API instead.

emails.description: The user's emails. This can be used to add, remove, or re-order emails. The first email in the list is the user's primary email.

items.description: Full response body for get group (department, call center) operations.

text.description: The contents of the message that should be sent.

sender_group_type.description: The ID type (i.e. office, department, or callcenter).

user_id.description: The ID of the user who should be the sender of the SMS.

sender_group_id.description: The ID of an office, department, or call center that the User should  send the message on behalf of.

to_numbers.description: Up to 10 E164-formatted phone numbers who should receive the SMS.

admin_email.description: Email address of the company administrator.

items.description: Full response body for get room operations.
Full response body for get user operations.

lines.description: An array of individual lines of the transcript.

customer_ref.description: An identifier to be printed in the usage summary. Typically used for identifying the person who requested the PIN.

license.description: The user's license type. This affects billing for the user.

items.description: Full response body for get office operations.

group_calls_only.description: Call event subscription for group calls only.

enabled.description: Whether or not the call event subscription is enabled.

call_states.description: The call event subscription's list of call states.

signature.description: Call event subscription's signature containing the secret.

id.description: The call event subscription's hook id.

rooms.description: Full response body for get room operations.

users.description: Full response body for get user operations.

group_calls_only.description: Call event subscription for group calls only.

enabled.description: Whether or not the call event subscription is enabled.

secret.description: The call event subscription's signature secret.

call_states.description: The call event subscription's list of call states.

office.description: Full response body for get office operations.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who was speaking.

name.description: The name of the call participant who was speaking.

contact_id.description: The ID of the contact who was speaking.

time.description: The time at which the line was spoken.
